search

Class Search

  • java.lang.Object
    • search.Search
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FrontierSearch, IterativeDeepeningTreeSearch

    public abstract class Search
extends java.lang.Object
    The Search abstract class encapsulates the notion of a search algorithm which seeks a solution for reaching a State that satisfies a Goal Test by starting from a root State and pursuing actions to reach new states until a goal State is found or until no further new States can be reached. The algorithm can also instantiate methods which find all solutions satisfying given constraints
    Author:
    Simon Campbell

      An optional method that, given a root State, a goal test, and a constraint on any solution path, returns the set of possible solutions satisfying the constraint
      abstract Node findSolution(State root, GoalTest goalTest)
      A method that, given a root State and a goal test, returns a node containing a solution or null if no solution can be found.
      abstract Node findSolution(State root, InferenceGoalTest inferenceGoalTest)
      A method that, given a root State and an inference goal test, returns a node containing a solution or null if no solution can be found.
      abstract int getLastSearchNodeCount()
      A method that returns the number of nodes generated during the last search, returns -1 if no search has been run

    • Method Detail

      • findSolution

        public abstract Node findSolution(State root,
                GoalTest goalTest)
        A method that, given a root State and a goal test, returns a node containing a solution or null if no solution can be found.
        Parameters:
        root - - the initial starting state for the search
        goalTest - - the goal test which determines whether any given state is a goal state
        Returns:
        A Node which defines a solution path ending in a goal or if non-such was found, null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either argument is null

      • findSolution

        public abstract Node findSolution(State root,
                InferenceGoalTest inferenceGoalTest)
        A method that, given a root State and an inference goal test, returns a node containing a solution or null if no solution can be found.
        Parameters:
        root - - the initial starting state for the search
        inferenceGoalTest - - the goal test which determines whether any given state is a goal state and also whether any given state may lead to a goal state
        Returns:
        A Node which defines a solution path ending in a goal or if non-such was found, null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either argument is null

      • getLastSearchNodeCount

        public abstract int getLastSearchNodeCount()
        A method that returns the number of nodes generated during the last search, returns -1 if no search has been run
        Returns:
        the number of nodes generated during the last search

      • findAllSolutions

        public abstract java.util.Set<Node> findAllSolutions(State root,
                                   GoalTest goalTest,
                                   PathConstraint pathConstraint)
        An optional method that, given a root State, a goal test, and a constraint on any solution path, returns the set of possible solutions satisfying the constraint
        Parameters:
        root - - the initial starting state for the search
        goalTest - - the goal test which determines whether any given state is a goal state
        pathConstraint - - a constraint of the solution path's that can be returned
        Returns:
        A Node which defines a solution path ending in a goal or if non-such was found, null
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the method is not implemented
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either argument is null and the operation is supported
